options.label: eccentricity
options.fig.cap: Some example shapes and their eccentricity statistics
options.fig.alt: Some example shapes and their eccentricity statistics. Circles and squares have the smallest eccentricity values while X shapes and lightning bolts have the largest. Also, the eccentricity is the same when shapes are rotated.

options.label: beans-corr-plot
options.ref.label: dimensionality-corr-plot
options.fig.cap: Correlation matrix of the predictors with variables ordered via clustering
options.fig.alt: A correlation matrix of the predictors with variables ordered via clustering. There are two to three clusters that have high within cluster correlations.

options.label: recipe-process
options.fig.alt: A summary of the recipe-related functions.

options.label: bean-area
options.ref.label: dimensionality-bake-off
options.fig.cap: The `area` predictor before and after preprocessing
options.fig.alt: The `area` predictor before and after preprocessing. The before panel shows a right-skewed, slightly bimodal distribution. The after panel has a distribution that is fairly bell shaped.

options.label: bean-pca
options.ref.label: dimensionality-pca
options.fig.cap: Principal component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class
options.fig.alt: Principal component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class. The classes separate when the first two components are plotted against one another.

options.label: pca-loadings
options.ref.label: dimensionality-pca-loadings
options.fig.cap: Predictor loadings for the PCA transformation
options.fig.alt: Predictor loadings for the PCA transformation. For the first component, the major axis length, second shape factor, convex area, and area have the largest effect.

options.label: bean-pls
options.ref.label: dimensionality-pls
options.fig.cap: PLS component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class
options.fig.alt: PLS component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class. The first two PLS components are nearly identical to the first two PCA components.

options.label: pls-loadings
options.ref.label: dimensionality-pls-loadings
options.fig.cap: Predictor loadings for the PLS transformation
options.fig.alt: Predictor loadings for the PLS transformation. For the first component, the major axis length, second shape factor, the equivalent diameter, convex area, and area have the largest effect.

options.label: bean-ica
options.ref.label: dimensionality-ica
options.fig.cap: ICA component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class
options.fig.alt: ICA component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class. There is significant overlap in the first two ICA components.

options.label: bean-umap
options.ref.label: dimensionality-umap
options.fig.cap: UMAP component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class
options.fig.alt: UMAP component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class. There is a very high degree of separation between clusters, but several of the clusters contain more than one class.

options.label: bean-umap-supervised
options.ref.label: dimensionality-umap-supervised
options.fig.cap: Supervised UMAP component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class
options.fig.alt: Supervised UMAP component scores for the bean validation set, colored by class. There is again a very high degree of separation between clusters, and there are now fewer instances of one cluster containing multiple classes.

options.label: dimensionality-rankings
options.fig.cap: Area under the ROC curve from the validation set
options.fig.alt: Area under the ROC curve from the validation set. The three best model configurations use PLS together with regularized discriminant analysis, a multi-layer perceptron, and a naive Bayes model.
